channel.title: Need help with Portforwarding || Rep++
channel.description:
Okay, this is a pretty nooby topic, so you Guru's should be able to help me with this. I've portforwarded on my other laptop, but I just can't seem to do it right on this one.
Okay, so I know the router isn't the problem, because it's already got 43594 open. I know that the router is portforwarded cause I hosted a server on my old laptop, using the same router as I'm using now.
Also, I know it's not my firewall, because I turned the firewall off for a bit, and I still couldn't get my server to connect.
So I don't have a single clue as to how to get this working. ________________________________
I'll go through what I've done so far, so you can see if I missed a step.
Okay, so I downloaded No-IP first. I got it running, and added a host. Then, I made sure the router still had port 43594 open. It did. Next, I opened up port 43594 in my firewall. Fourth, I ran my server. Fifth, I checked it on Runelocus's Server Status Checker, and used both my reg IP, and my No-IP, and it didn't work. Then, I used 2 other sources, just to make sure it wasn't just that one. Finally, I came here cause none of them worked.
All help is GREATLY appriciated guys. <3

item.title: Need help with Portforwarding || Rep++
item.dc:creator: @TimeBroken TimeBroken
item.description:
@TimeBroken wrote:

Okay, this is a pretty nooby topic, so you Guru’s should be able to help me with this. I’ve portforwarded on my other laptop, but I just can’t seem to do it right on this one.

Okay, so I know the router isn’t the problem, because it’s already got 43594 open. I know that the router is portforwarded cause I hosted a server on my old laptop, using the same router as I’m using now.

Also, I know it’s not my firewall, because I turned the firewall off for a bit, and I still couldn’t get my server to connect.

So I don’t have a single clue as to how to get this working.

I’ll go through what I’ve done so far, so you can see if I missed a step.

Okay, so I downloaded No-IP first. I got it running, and added a host.
Then, I made sure the router still had port 43594 open. It did.
Next, I opened up port 43594 in my firewall.
Fourth, I ran my server.
Fifth, I checked it on Runelocus’s Server Status Checker, and used both my reg IP, and my No-IP, and it didn’t work.
Then, I used 2 other sources, just to make sure it wasn’t just that one.
Finally, I came here cause none of them worked.

All help is GREATLY appriciated guys.
<3
